website_summaries.verdict: Good price for a Chromebook that has a nice set of all-around features for basic tasks.
pros: Designed for use in tough conditions with rubber guards and spill resistant keyboard
Offers 16 GB of SSD storage and 4 GB of RAM, which are good features for a Chromebook in this price range
cons: Slower processor than some other models

customer_reviews.title: 49 year old 3D designer, very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: 49 year old 3D designer here. I was looking for a light weight solution to get me out of my office when I just needed to use the internet, google docs etc. Figured for $200 it would just be a nice little cheap toy. This thing is pretty amazing. Nice keyboard, decent screen, great webcam (to use mostly with Hangouts) good speakers and its really fast. I watched about 4 hours of videos on battery and it only went down to 79% full. Solid unit, very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery problems with this model are common.
customer_reviews.text: This chrome book only lasted three and a half months. The battery will not hold a charge, apparently this is a common problem with this model. I bought this from Amazon warehouse. I have always been happy with my purchases through them, but this time it didn't work out.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel C.

customer_reviews.title: it doesnt have a caps lock button but thats okay ...
customer_reviews.text: it doesnt have a caps lock button but thats okay because i probably shouldnt be yelling at people over the internet anyway
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Can't write a good review, had it on for about 5 minutes and it locked up. Finally got it to turn off and when it came back on all we got was a black screen.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The battery life is long and the display is very nice. It is ruggedized as advertised which is definitely ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my husband to replace his current laptop. It is also starting to take the place of his tablet too. He loves the versatility of the Chromebook. He can use it to work and the kids can watch movies on it. The battery life is long and the display is very nice. It is ruggedized as advertised which is definitely a great feature with two children tearing the house apart on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a month and a half
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in June 2017. It worked until July 2017. I noticed some minor problems right away with my documents opening on their own and had to reset the laptop to factory settings. I had to reset twice. Today, I turned on the laptop and it showed the startup screen (white screen with the word "Chrome.") It then went black and blinked the startup screen again. It keeps going on and off. It worked for a little less than a month and a half. I'm returning it. It would have been a great little laptop if it had worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Fast, durable and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Speed is fast. Plays movies in HD, (ie. NETFLIX is playing in the picture). Super durable, my nephew has dropped it multiple times and still works as new. I definitely recommend this is you're looking for a Chrome Book, instead using a laptop. To my father it does more than he uses it for. It also has a decent front facing camera that actually has good quality. We've Skyped on it many times. If you're not a gamer, video editor or a power user of Microsoft excel, ect. - this Chrome Book is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ben O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: For the price and the specs its a great chromebook.
customer_reviews.text: For the price and the specs its a great chromebook...the problem is that the hardware is faulty. After about a month's worth of use, it randomly shut off one day. I have yet been able to turn it on. I am thinking it might be the power adaptor. I am going to test it later today. Regardless, after searching in the comments for similar issues, this seems to be persistent with this product. They should do a recall on this product or offer free hardware repairs since this is a very common issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for my homeschooling children. This computer was great for the couple of months that it worked. We did all the right things. No computer on laps or beds...It just turned off one day and simply would not turn back on. It won't even charge. My son had his replaced after only a week of use and his won't turn on now either. 3/3 bad laptops is too much. I would avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: A. S. Berry

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life and Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I've been a chromebook fan for years. Because we travel a lot I wanted a more ruggedized model. I'm more than happy with this device. And the battery has been lasting for a full 10 hours. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hoch

customer_reviews.title: I ordered it in June. It's only about 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it in June. It's only about 3 months old and it randomly just shuts off. Screen goes black, and has to be restarted. Then it sometimes does it again! I understand it's a cheap computer, but it's not really worth the aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent value
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this little guy for about a month now and we're impressed. It doesn't feel laggy, the screen resolution is sufficient, and it just feels sturdy and rugged, while remaining lightweight. The keys have a decent feel to them and don't feel crowded. The apps run fine and synching with Google services such as Calendar and Keep is great. Network connection speeds are smooth. This really has been a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Very good laptop for basic stuff. Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Light but solid, responsive, pretty good keyboard, impressive battery life. Do you want to surf the web, do your email, watch internet videos, write the Great American Novel, video chat, teach yourself how to create web pages, AND not worry about destroying a $1,000+ piece of electronic equipment with a 7-11 Big Gulp? I think you may be hard pressed to get more bang for your buck than this gadget right here.
customer_reviews.author: RicheTheBuddha

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. There's no better description. It has a slot for my usb Verizon connection to the internet. It has a slot for the dongle (?) for my full-sized mouse. It's light weight. Fully charged it seems to hold that charge for quite a while. I couldn't be happier. And the price was reasonable. If you, like me, don't need a lot of "stuff" on a computer, this is it. But it even has a memory card slot and built in camera.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Kayaker

customer_reviews.title: I loved mine. Got it in December and used it ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved mine. Got it in December and used it just about daily. Perfect for me. However, yesterday I spilled coffee and it got in the keyboard and it immediately stopped working. The unit would turn on, but the screen remained black. It's totally my fault, no blame to the company or product, but watching him pour that mug of water on the keyboard made me cringe. I'm not sure how "waterproof" it is. I'm also not sure I could spill the coffee again like I did, so it was a freak accident. Anyway, I ordered another 10 minutes after the spill. So, I guess you could say I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: K.H.

customer_reviews.title: Warranty is not as shown in video.
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook work well but do not go by the video shown. It shows a person pouring water into keyboard with no damage; dropping it from a table top to the floor with no damage. Says it is an "easy fix" if something does go wrong, just pop the damaged part out and pop a new one in. This is a lie! If it shows any sign of 'physical damage' your warranty is void. I just paid 210.00 for this notebook to have the motherboard replaced when all I sent it back for was a broken head phone piece. I purchased an extended warranty at time of purchase also, guessing this is worthless also.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Marie Pitts

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of these a few months ago, ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these a few months ago, now both have been sent back to ASUS for repair. Both will no longer charge the battery. I attempted two different charging cords. ASUS repair in Texas has still not fixed the power issue, Still waiting on parts after 30 days Both of mine had issues about 9 months into the warranty. I think they are seeing many of these show up with a similar problem..
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B.

customer_reviews.title: My daughter uses google docs though and she's been fine.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter uses this for her online public school courses as well as her online college courses and she loves it. Just be aware that there is no caps lock, you can't right click and there's no dvd/CD player. You can download Microsoft office but you have to do it online. My daughter uses google docs though and she's been fine.
customer_reviews.author: THB

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality key layout, no warranty support when it fails
customer_reviews.text: We had a key pop off under totally normal usage, and ASUS would not repair it under warranty. They quoted us $130 to replace a KEY. This is allegedly a ruggedized chromebook, yet you can't even type on it without keys popping off and they consider that unwarrantied damage by user. Ridiculous. I have been an ASUS customer for a long time, this is really making me rethink this.
customer_reviews.author: DTrux

customer_reviews.title: It is nice looking and durable
customer_reviews.text: It is nice looking and durable; I have accidentally lightly dropped it several times from the couch to the floor, nothing was broken; however, when using chrome for a long period of time, the screen would blacken for a little while and back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Vu

customer_reviews.title: Its Durability is questionable.
customer_reviews.text: after 6 months since purchase the Chromebook's screen blew a fuse. There is no visible damage from the outside, even though this device is "Suppose" to handle falls or liquids.
customer_reviews.author: Nina K. Luciano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price, if it does what you need.
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook offers excellent value for the price, if it does what you need. The build quality is very solid, the screen image quality is quite good for its size, the keyboard is comfortable enough for touch typing, and the N3060 CPU is powerful enough to handle most net-centric activities -- i.e. checking/read/writing emails, streaming videos, light productivity work with the Google apps/G-Suite. If that's all you need to do when you're on the go, it's hard to beat the price on this machine!
customer_reviews.author: A. Pann

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: It was great and I kinda liked it until I went to power it up after two days use (less then 12 hours use). Wouldn’t even turn on when I pressed power button, no damage and nothing downloaded to make it act up, literally sat on my computer desk closed and powered off every time until I wanted to use it again, had to return it just waiting for refund. DEFINITELY WILL NOT RECOMMEND ONE BIT!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Worked for just 2 months and then if battery ran ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for just 2 months and then if battery ran down, would not start, giving message to reload Chrome operating system. Now unit will run only when plugged into AC. Will not run on battery power. Attempted to contact ASUS Tech support via their email support address. No response. Unlikely to consider buying another ASUS prroduct. Update: I discovered that since the unit was "refurbished" it was classified and without warranty when finally trying to get repaired under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: dougbadger

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this to use as a tertiary machine, ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as a tertiary machine, and it has exceeded expectations considering the price. Though Chrome OS can be limiting as far as offline applications are concerned, the developer mode allows the user to run a Linux desktop, effectively side-stepping this concern. I use the laptop occasionally, and the charge has been lasting for about a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In less than a year, this chromebook's motherboard failed ...
customer_reviews.text: In less than a year, this chromebook's motherboard failed because of physical damage(we did not open it) and the repair thru ASUS would cost me $215 to repair my "rugged" chromebook! It was still under warranty from the manufacturer. The video showing the person dropping it should give a disclaimer that it might not be covered under the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: ashley sybrandy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the handiest little thing, and the battery charge lasts just about forever.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mayhem

customer_reviews.title: It is great for what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: It is great for what I wanted. Fast 5 minutes out of the box. I miss a back lit keyboard and number pad, but that is not what I bought it for. It is easy to transport and appears rugged. The 180 degree opening is nice. I gave it 5 stars because for $200 it does it's job! I can carry it in a pack or bookbag, it is light and thje screen actually works in the sun! Thank you! I received this in 3 days on a Sunday...
customer_reviews.author: James J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Stopped charging after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 6 months ago and this week it just stopped charging. I noticed some others have had this issue as well. Very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Little Tank
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the little tank that could. 10 hour battery life. Quick startup/restart time. Not easily compromised by water. Easy panel removal for parts replacements. Large keys with easy give. Simple Shortcuts: Even though it doesn't have buttons designated for CAPS or Function Keys, I can change purpose of unused to suit my needs. Works with most Android apps. Downside: Runs entirely on apps and extensions (which is great because there's little chance for viruses), but occasionally my screen will freeze up, fade to black, and then resume what I was doing. The blackouts my be a side effect of using certain extensions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Chromebook. Runs Android Apps.
customer_reviews.text: THIS CHROMEBOOK SUPPORTS ANDROID APPS !!! I could not be happier. After I did the latest update, Google Play allowed me to download any android app right onto the chromebook. You can install everything from games to uber on it. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Woodcement

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: It's great for what it is. Just know it really only gets you on the internet. You can't install programs and it's honestly sort of slow. But not horrible for the money. It's lightweight and silent. It doesn't overheat, and if you have an android it synchs so everything is connected. You don't even have to log in, if your phone is near it just starts where you left off.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: weather resistant chromebook gets more outdoor time than my tablet
customer_reviews.text: ASUS build is solid, water resistant, claims 10 hr battery (more like 9 plus so far) and handles Android apps now. Sound is just ok, on board memory is 2nd gen capacity (next series is getting seriously larger) but using the SD slot for additional storage. Attached to Deloren InReach gps/sat txt and using it with additional usb battery that has 19vdc capacity. works ok and will handle libre office or apache office so I don't worry about being offline. tethered to my cell phone ok as well and home wifi works ok too. turning out to be a better replacement to my laptop and my tablet. Next is to see if VLC android will work.
customer_reviews.author: anotherconsumer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 5th grade
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5th grader for BYOD (bring your own device) for school. Very easy for her to set up, battery lasts a good 10 hours, and she can use Google docs. Great size and light weight. Very study (she has dropped it twice without breakage).
customer_reviews.author: RBo

customer_reviews.title: Won't work after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this computer I loved it it was fast it was good quality however, after only two months the computer no longer works. The chrome screen comes on but it does not load. Complete waste of money. This was the second computer that I got from them the first one came with a broken key which I returned and they sent me a new one and this one worked for just 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Motz

customer_reviews.title: The battery life on this thing is amazing, truly
customer_reviews.text: The battery life on this thing is amazing, truly. That said, it's missing a lot of keys that a more standard keyboard has. While initially this doesn't seem like a big deal, it actually annoys me more and more every day. If you're a proficient typist operating off of muscle memory, it completely throws you off. Be prepared to type = instead of backspace over and over again!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook With Access To The Google Playstore!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a whim back in March 2017 for $188 shipped. I can say this is by far the best $188 I've spend on a computer. It is ultraportable and well-built. The only thing I find lacking is the screen quality but I can't complain considering the price. I already fell I got my money's worth out of this computer. I also got access to the google play store with last nights update (08/18/2017) so for those of you that are looking for a chromebook with play store access in the stable branch this one now has it!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: Fine for basic use, poor for live video
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chrome book for my nine-year-old when she switch to distance-learning. The design is very sturdy and the screen is clear. It’s perfectly good for basic function like Google Docs, web browsing etc. I am very disappointed in the quality of the video connection when she uses zoom to log into her live classes. She constantly complained about it freezing and being glitchy on zoom calls with her class. We have other devices on the same Wi-Fi network that are working perfectly. I think it’s due to the low processing speed of this device. I wish I had bought her a faster processing speed basically it was a waste of money for distance-learning.
customer_reviews.author: Mantra G. Raffel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this to anyone I meet who is considering buying a computer for general use. I have not tested the limits. I am a forty year computer professional who started programming in 1978. I own many systems. I bought this one to take on my travels. I wanted a small, lightweight laptop like system that could get my email and play movies. This does all of that. I am impressed with the chrome operating system. It just works. Everything I have done works. I believe there is a privacy concern, but I am not concerned. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: John Wells

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop in the world
customer_reviews.text: Best laptop in the world. You can do all you need (as long you don't use it for heavy school or professional work) and is very fast. You can close it and when you open it back it starts running back in 5 seconds. Great for surfing the web. Great image quality. So happy.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Ruggedized, fast, runs smoothly, the only thing is for kids who are used to installing apps for games they want to play you are limited to whats on the google web store which is NOT the same as Google Play Store. Besides that fact, it's a great piece of equipment. Worth the price as well!
customer_reviews.author: William - NJ

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT CASUAL CHROMEBOOK
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this little handy Chromebook! I bought this one USED, since all of my electronics are either refurbished, or lightly used because I find most electronics are not worth NEW price. I use a main PC as my work station, but I bought this for light school use for PAPERS, BROWSING, and listening to MUSIC and so far it works GREAT! Opened right up, plug and play, perfect for casual use for STUDENTS, MOM/POP, or even teenagers!
customer_reviews.author: JamminJeremy

customer_reviews.title: This is not a laptop!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a laptop! This is like an android tablet! Actually worse! I was mislead into thinking that I was getting a laptop because when I did a search, I put in laptops, but this piece of sh..! showed up! You can't do anything with it! And I found that sooner than later, you will run out of storage because the small storage can't store the many updates. I give this a kick in the a..!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father as his old laptop was on it's way out. He needed something for basic web access and watching YouTube videos, this suits him fine and he likes that it doesn't get hot the way a laptop does. It is also much lighter than a laptop and the battery life is great. I have used it myself and it and am happy this is the one we went with.
customer_reviews.author: A.K. Van Daft

customer_reviews.title: Black screen less than a month old
customer_reviews.text: My son has had this less than a month and randomly today when he powered it on the screen is black. It has not been damaged at all. I purchased the additional protection plan so I tried to file a claim but was denied and told to contact customer support who I emailed this evening. I will update my review if and when this is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Sara C

customer_reviews.title: Good performance and durability
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this Asus Chrome book daily for 17months. The waterproof keyboard, rugged exterior and low price are the reasons for this purchase. My last laptop slipped off the bed a couple of feet and started giving me some problems. I can honestly say this has been perfect for my needs. No problems; a light weight and tough laptop with the performance that exceeds my expectations, at such an affordable price. It's nice to know that if it falls or gets splashed on, it will still work without skipping a beat.
customer_reviews.author: CM King

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop for writers, simple business, AND the elderly (or young)...
customer_reviews.text: Best computer for writers out there. However, this is supposed to have touch screen?...uh no, it doesn’t, lol. BUT...if you need a computer for simple stuff (google drive, emailing, writing apps, etc.), AND want to enjoy the Spotify and Netflix apps while traveling (all useable in airplane mode via the download options), this is your best bet! This was actually the second one I purchased. First, last year, for me...second, this one, for my 87 year old grandfather who needed something simple for playing solitaire :)
customer_reviews.author: Erin Van Vuren

customer_reviews.title: Shuts Down and Will Not Start.
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook is terrible quality. -Shortly after buying it, it shut down and there was no way to start it again. -Company would not allow a return, even for faulty product, only option was to send it to be repaired. -Must send to Texas to be repaired -Must pay for shipping for the repair, which was costly. -Even after repair, after a few months, the same problem has occurred, so the problem was not fixed. Very unhappy with the product and service. Do not waste your money, and do not buy from this company, because the product is not good for whatever reason, and the return process is not what Amazon users are used to.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: This laptop is perfect for me as a commuting student/researcher
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is perfect for me as a commuting student/researcher; it's light-weight, affordable, and can be used for my basic needs. The battery life lasts about 10+ hours, I've even gone a full week without charging it at some point. I did add an external 32GB USB for extra storage space since the laptop only contains 16GB.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Useless Toy
customer_reviews.text: This is neat. It really is. Especially when you run Linux on it. My only problem is this was marketed as a Chromebook for the classroom but when you take a college class using Microsoft Office and can't transfer a Word Document to Moodle without it opening the file and scrambling the formatting... It's useless. Neat toy. Can't get any school work done with it.
customer_reviews.author: SCS

customer_reviews.title: These are great for teenagers
customer_reviews.text: My daughter destroyed the corners of her previous chromebook because she would drop it (clumsy girl lol). I decided to get this one and it's great with the protected corners and the feel of it is so much better overall from the other chromebooks we've had
customer_reviews.author: Chevonne Llamas

customer_reviews.title: Everything my husband wanted
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband. He primarily checks email and Facebook so it couldn't be more perfect! So easy to set up (just sign into your gmail). I will say that on the first one we received the touchpad only worked in the bottom right corner. I immediately went on Amazon, clicked the exchange button for returns and explained the problem. A new one arrived 2 days later and is perfect. Sent the defective one back postage paid by Amazon. Easy peasy. Light weight, holds a charge for a very long time and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: *Unable to Charge less than 30 days!*
customer_reviews.text: Would not charge in less than 30 days. Horrible customer service from Amazon Prime. 20 year account holder. Took over 3 hours on the phone to resolve during various conversations for $250 bucks. Waste of time and $ I will not purchase electronics from Amazon again. Stick with Costco or Best Buy.
customer_reviews.author: MimiNVA

customer_reviews.title: Good not Great
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few weeks to review this ASUS cause I wanted to put it threw its paces.Sturdy construction with a rubberized boarder for better grip while carrying it.The SD card slot you push the sd card all the way in it doesn't hang out like my old chromebook. The camera is fuzzy but when you record it and play it back on you tube it clears up.The audio is lacking also I have it turned up to max volume and what ever media im listening to is also turned all the way up.It still sounds like half volume.In my opinion the fuzzy camera and poor volume keeps it from being a great chromebook
customer_reviews.author: Devil duck

customer_reviews.title: Awful machine. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ASUS for my daughters Zoom class along with other online learning websites. The volume was distorted, the screen resolution was grainy and choppy. People always complained about not being able to hear us (even with the microphone volume adjusted) the Asus also froze at least once a day. I returned the Asus and got the Lenovo chromebook c330 and I am so happy with the switch. I would not recommend the Asus if you intend to use it for internet/online use.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley23

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great petite laptop!
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook is pretty great! I'd recommend it for anyone who wants to get a pretty petite laptop for a reasonable price. Though, I gave it a four star rating because sometimes it will freeze and won't respond to your toach and just turn off for about 15 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: It shows no wear and is truly one of my best utility purchases
customer_reviews.text: Approaching a year of ownership for this chromebook. I bought it when my macbook pro died quite early and needed a cheap option for school on the fly. Its served me well day in and day out. I work in a brewery now and it constantly gets condensation dripped on it when it's playing music. It's been thrown around in tool bags without any babying. It shows no wear and is truly one of my best utility purchases. I can't recommend this book enough. I won't buy a full laptop again after such a positive experience compared to all of my half dozen other laptop purchases over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Poedonk

customer_reviews.title: Broke during first day of use.
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook broke on the day it was received. The pointer completely stopped working and after countless attempts to fix the problem technologically we determined it was defective hardware and it had to be returned. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Works but beware of the limitations
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cause I needed a computer for work that was simple and worked with Office 365. Connects well to internet via USB adapter or WiFi. Only issue is printing, my office doesn’t have any Chromebook acceptable printers, so I have to either email my reports or transfer to a flash drive and use a different computer to print. Keep this in mind when buying, if you plan on printing, you’re going to need a Chromebook acceptable printer and a WiFi app to print wirelessly. I wish I knew this before I bought it or else I would have gotten a cheap Windows laptop instead. Other than that it works easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Tobias

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the money for the ruggedized version trust me!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ten-year-old son as his first "laptop". My cheap tendencies really gave me a hard time about paying so much more for a so-called ruggedized version, but I can say with complete confidence that my son would have destroyed it by now had it not been like Army grade!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This was great til it completely stopped working. One minute it was on and had over half battery the next it was off and won't charge or anything. I've only had this for 3 months, it's crap, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working in a little over 3 months...
customer_reviews.text: So, I liked this computer a lot initially. I mean it wasn't the best laptop for it's price but it was lightweight, charged quickly, and held the charge for a long time. It was a great little device for school and working from home. But yesterday, completely out of the blue, it just stopped working. It won't charge. The screen is black. Nothing. I'm sorely disappointed. I know paying $200 for a machine like this means it won't last forever but I expected it to last at least a year or two... If I were you, I would really consider paying a bit more for a better machine.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids & teens
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has used this for over two years. Other than one letter key that came off and disappeared (still works without the key) it's in perfect condition. And she is not careful with it. For kids who use Google Classroom (docs, sheets, drive, etc.) this is exactly the tool they need. She can also watch videos, play games, and waste time on social media. It is very rugged and performs well.
customer_reviews.author: JulieMKY

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my little sister to do her homework while away from school. (due to the Covid-19) It has worked wonders!! She's spilled Ice-cream, water, juice, dropped it multiple times! NOTHING HAS GONE WRONG!! This laptop is a miracle! Does exactly what is says it's supposed to do! HIGHLY SATISFIED CUSTOMER! Will purchase another one in the future!

customer_reviews.title: Great for web browsing, light as a feather
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is for using the internet. That's it. It so happens that 99.9% of my computing needs are just getting on the internet and wasting time and money. This computer is great for that. The speakers are very loud (but don't don't deliver super-great sound quality), the screen is good enough for me (but maybe not for someone who is really into watching 4k video or some other graphics-heavy use). It's lightweight and the battery so far has been great. I really enjoy using it. At this price point, I cannot imagine a better experience.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dravec

customer_reviews.title: NO BACKLIGHT ON KEYBOARD!! KEYS DARK BLUE ON BLACK.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Chromebook. I fell for the low price. I can live without a touchscreen but not the keyboard. Keys are black and lettering is DARK BLUE with no keyboard backlighting! Talk about eyestrain! Amazon Support recommended I upgrade to ASUS 302. (TWICE THE PRICE) Been there, done that! (It lasted less than 6 months and went dead). I thought I'd give it one more try and this is what I get. I have an external keyboard I can use..... UPDATE: After contacting Amazon Representative I was offered and accepted a 20% refund. This was enough for me to keep this Asus and add a few stars.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Broke 35 days after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Was unlucky with this device. Amazon offers 30 days return policy. This device failed (hardware failure) 35 days after receiving it. There was no drop, water or any other event with the device. Was actively using it and the track pad just stopped working and is not even recognized by the chrome operating system after reboot. Amazon would not accept it for return and Asus wanted to charge me to ship it for repair. Guess I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon M. Harty

customer_reviews.title: It is dependable
customer_reviews.text: I had my last ASUS Chromebook for about four and a half years and it worked great. I was going to get the same model but it was not sold anymore. I could have got one a little faster and a little bigger screen, but this one is water resistant and shock resistant and that means more to me. I think it looks great for a pc that can take a beating, and still keep working.
customer_reviews.author: lazyj

customer_reviews.title: NOT a durable Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of junk, given it CLAIMS to be ruggedized. It is no more durable than any other typical laptop style computer in this class. Also, it is very far from spill proof - I spilled a small amount of beverage on the keys, and a few minutes later I heard it sizzling. Now it's a paperweight. I didn't expect it to be totally waterproofed, but they did use "spill proof" as a SELLING POINT and to see it die within minutes of such a minor accident was a serious letdown.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for middle school to be able to use for distance learning. You would think that the chromebook, a google product would be seamless for google platform meeting apps, but it is not. It was fine for google classroom work but anytime there was a video call it froze and she would have to call in without video. I mean talk about defeating the purpose. And it wasn't a wifi issue as the wifi works great on every other device in the house. It was very frustrating. If you need to make video calls get a real laptop and skip the chromebook altogether.
customer_reviews.author: cjwend

customer_reviews.title: DOA! AND What is this plug???
customer_reviews.text: We needed to use the computer right away, as it is the beginning of the school year. When it was opened, it did not come on. When we pulled out the power cord, a plug like no other I have ever seen was at the end of the cord!? What the heck, ASUS? Did you send me a product for a European power system? I scoured the description of the machine and in no place did I see that information. I will be buying a different computer today - probably NOT an ASUS, even if I loved the overall specs.
customer_reviews.author: James Fite

customer_reviews.title: the only thing in the past 10 years I've returned from amazon
customer_reviews.text: saw this on a pop-up sale on amazon... price looked too good to be true. Well, you know what THAT means, right? hahaha It certainly was too good to be true. Maybe it's ok for a kindergarten or first grader, as a student machine. But for any other use (and yes, I mean ANY other use) by a somewhat adult person, avoid this piece of plastic at all costs. Not recommended at ALL (other than say, the rugged plastic construction... but seriously... thats about IT)
customer_reviews.author: John Vondracek

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, no issues
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, great value. Have had for three months and no issues whatsoever. Great for schoolwork, online games, web browsing. Make sure you understand what a chromebook is and is not before you purchase one. It is not a traditional laptop! But for our purposes where we work almost entirely in the cloud, it’s better than a traditional laptop.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mendonca

customer_reviews.title: Great first laptop for kids and great for adults
customer_reviews.text: Extremely lightweight and has survived being dropped with zero damage. This was purchased for a middle school child whose teachers will post guides, homework, and lessons in google folders that the kids can access. He uses it all the time which makes it a steal at less than $200. ***Before purchasing, do a quick google search to make sure all the programs you need will work on it. This isn't a laptop for Minecraft coding, Fortnite, or Adobe Creative Suite. However it is great for all things Google/G Suite, schoolwork, research, and internet use.
customer_reviews.author: investinyourself

customer_reviews.title: Kid Safe!
customer_reviews.text: So far, we are very pleased with this purchase. The unit is well made, easy to use and to move about. We purchased this for a 2nd grader to use at home for online classes at this time. Because he had used a Chromebook at school, he jumped right in and was able to use it. I was concerned about the small size because he was used to a large monitor but it has turned out to be perfect for him. He loves the touch pad and the keyboard is fine. Overall, I would recommend this for a elementary age child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size and functionality!
customer_reviews.text: We've had some issues figuring out how to use some things (printing was really hard for us with this, for some reason) but overall -- it is an amazing little device for school. Our HS has a complete set for students to use, and we bought this for our middle school daughter. It is just the right size, worked consistently all year, and really was impressive. We also use it to stream movies and tv to our large tv, using an HDMI cable. It is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter who is very tough on computers and keyboards. She loves it. It is lightweight and tough and surprisingly fast. She can have YouTube, Spotify, MySMS, and many other apps and tabs open with no loss in speed. She says the battery lasts about 10 hours. She throws it in her bacpack (no sleeve or cover) and it seems to take whatever she can guve it. For less than $200, pretty much the perfect computer for her. Connects easily to whatever WiFi is around, works seamlessly with all Google stuff (photos, drive, contacts, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Sonja Harken

customer_reviews.title: Good hardy laptop, would be great for kids
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the fastest Chromebook out there, but it is quite tough. The keyboard is very nice to use and the keys have good travel. The battery life is very good, easily lasting all day without plugging in. My only real gripe is that it's pretty thick. I have no doubts it will outlast the laptop it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: B. VanBogart

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Boots up fast. Stays charged for a long time. Already dropped it, it was fine. Lightweight. It does use Google docs, etc. Which might have a learning curve. You cannot load windows or itunes, but it states that before you but it. No CD drive either.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Detroit

customer_reviews.title: Looked like a nice tablet.
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box, hooked it up ( which by the way was very simple) I noticed that I had ordered it without noticing that it did not have touch screen and I must have it. I was comparing a few and must have checked the wrong one. I think it would be great for online learning or schooling or a student's work. I love my old ASUS but the hinge in split from the screen and it has been used and loved well. It is on its last leg. Since they are in shortage and I am not willing to sell the "cow" to get one, I am hoping it holds on a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Light-Copper

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works, but it's died twice now
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it's a nice device; very light, adequately fast, comfortable to use. Easy for my daughter to carry to and from school. I suppose if you got a "good one", it would be a 5-star device. Alas, one day it just died -- wouldn't boot or show any sign of life. Did the return/repair process. Got the machine back a couple of weeks later, and it worked fine, for a couple of weeks. Now it's dead again. Sending the device back for repair again is annoying, to say the least. File under "you get what you pay for".
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Plevin

customer_reviews.title: When I first opened it up I love the way it feels in your hands
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened it up I love the way it feels in your hands, keyboard is sturdy, the speed was good but i couldn't get certain websites to open (ebay, amazon) all I had to do was update my chromebook and the worked perfectly!!! very pleased so far. The screen does get a glare with certain lighting but you just have to move it around and i wish it was HD color but it's not. I use it for browsing the web and creating a document once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Drzewiecki

customer_reviews.title: I was super excited to receive this item
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to receive this item. It was everything I was hoping for and would have been thrilled with it, except after 48 hours for no reason it shut off and I could not reboot. Sent it back for replacement and received another that worked for a week then the same thing. Sent it back and asked for a refund. It doesn’t matter how cool it is if it doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: MRies

customer_reviews.title: Great travel laptop
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop! I bought it to have a lightweight, inexpensive laptop for travel and it's perfect. I love the durable shell, quick power on, and interface. It's my first chromebook and I've found I can accomplish most daily tasks on in including document writing and file attachments. It's so convenient and has such a great battery life that I've started using it more than my heavier MacBook. I've had it for 3 months now and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: MCF

customer_reviews.title: Completely dead after less than one year of use
customer_reviews.text: Chromebook worked great for a few months. Battery life was good and it was very light and portable. One day I opened it and it didn't turn on. I never dropped it or dropped anything on it. I took it to my school's IT department to have it looked at and they kept it for several days and returned it saying they couldn't do anything about it. I have no idea what happened to it but I would certainly not recommend it to anyone who wants a Chromebook that lasts for over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop and priced right! Love the ruggedized functions!
customer_reviews.text: Great Chromebook. I love that the screen is Matte finish which is easy to read outside. I love that it has a rugged shell and that it is waterproof too. I have a lot of health issues and always take this with me to the hospital. Perfect for my needs as I use it to check emails, recipes and play games. One of my favorite things is that the battery charges up extremely fast. So if battery gets run down, I plug it in and for what seems like 30min-hr, it's fully charged. My other laptops/tablets took forever to charge. And the life of the battery is great once fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: DRB

customer_reviews.title: This little computer is awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: This little computer is awesome for the price. My only gripe about Chromebooks is that they only print via cloud print. However, it's great for taking to school because it's so small and light. Great for anything on the internet, and even possible to do a little coding in the Chrome shell. Since Chrome is built on top of Linux XFCE, it's actually pretty easy to revert the system to Linux and be able to switch back and forth between Chrome and Linux. I can't use it quite like a desktop and I don't have a cloud-capable printer which sucks, but it's great for on the go. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: j. blackmon

customer_reviews.title: It's faster but not better than a typical Laptop as it doesn't have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for Dad. He loves it, it's the same system as his phone and it last a day or more. It's faster but not better than a typical Laptop as it doesn't have a HD drive that takes awhile to load. Don't be fooling thinking the speed of opening apps is an indication of power, it's not. But if your only using a laptop to check messages, sell stuff online, write some papers and spreadsheets. Here you go. If you have an android phone it's very useful as you can always check out google photo's and documents so long as their's a network.
customer_reviews.author: Derek D. Bergey

customer_reviews.title: Garbage - lasted 61 days
customer_reviews.text: This chromebook worked for 61 days before the screen went completely dead. ASUS could care less. They quoted me $200 to fix it. I had to be a jerk on the phone just to get them to agree to fix it outside their warranty window (60 days) for free. So after $30 to ship it to ASUS we have had it back for about 30 days. Dead again. It's garbage and ASUS costumer service is too.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Beavers

customer_reviews.title: Would not turn on after only 7 months of use. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this Chromebook on 5 February 2019 for business travel. On Sept 30, 2019 I would not turn on despite trying all of the suggestions on the manufacturers website. Very disappointing. I had to rush to buy another laptop while traveling so that I could continue working. It would be nice if a refund or replacement was offered.
customer_reviews.author: Waterman

customer_reviews.title: Great first computer for my middle schooler
customer_reviews.text: We gave this Chromebook to my son last Christmas, and it's been an excellent first computer as he transitioned into middle school this Fall. Other mom friends have asked me if an additional case or sleeve is needed, and I always tell them to save their money - this is an extremely sturdy laptop, and my son takes it to and from school in his backpack a couple times a week with no extra case. The ONLY con to this product is that the keyboard doesn't light up - something I'm used to on my MacBook - but it doesn't seem to bother my son.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent!!
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this for my daughter a sophomore in college a few months ago. She constantly breaks, cell phones, tablets and her laptops. So I said ok its for kids and break resistant, lets try. AWESOME device. For a child, teen or adult that are more prone to breakage. Its been dropped a few times, she is rather rough butno wesr and tear so far. Yet, its a really good device with all your typical items need for novice to intermediate users. Great for school. Its a really good device to have as a primary or back up device.
customer_reviews.author: 1flymom

customer_reviews.title: A low quality regret
customer_reviews.text: After 7 years, my Dell chromebook finally bit the dust. I found this chromebook for much cheaper than my Dell, and I can honestly say, you get what you pay for. The processing speed is painfully slow, the keys are clunky and not user friendly, and the bottom edges of the keyboard side of the frame cut into your wrists when you type. I teach and have used many different brands of chromebooks, and this one is the worst I've encountered so far. Hoping this one dies before 7 years so I can go back to Dell.
customer_reviews.author: talymc

customer_reviews.title: Software Updates end on 6/2022 (beware]
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware: software update support from Google for this device ends in june,202, rendering this device generally unusable and unsafe less than 2 years after purchae. It would be nice if Amazon made this clear. Kind of like buying a gallon of milk without an expiration date and it starts tasting funny on day 2, except that gallon of milk costs hundreds of dollars. Other than that, device is great for kids for remote learning. Lower end performance, but more than adequate for school work.
customer_reviews.author: Romilac

customer_reviews.title: Fun, functional and minimal
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a high school student, but I've had the chance to play with it. Chromebooks are limited, but unless you do hardware heavy stuff, a chromebook will do a great job. I'm a blogger who is fond of my Linux ultrabook, but I can see myself using a chromebook successfully. Aside from the OS, the laptop seems quite rugged, looks good and has ultrabook appearance on a shoestring budget. As long as you understand the limitations of the operating system, I doubt you will be dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy c

customer_reviews.title: Very Right for our 10-Year old
customer_reviews.text: Really Good Chromebook for our child: We like the fact one can access the Google Play Store, so this Chromebook is really a hybrid between a simple computer and an Android Tablet. (started shopping for a tablet and found this to be a better option). Very functional for play and school work. Our child is really enjoying it - a very fitting tech product for kids. So far speedy and dependable. Only wish it had a touchscreen, but for the price not reasonable to expect that much...
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hansen

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this laptop to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Everything i expected from a chrome book and more. The Spill proof keyboard came in handy the second day of use my 2 year old son spilled milk on it i just went to sink let milk drain poured a lil water on the keys to rinse the milk and pat it dry with a napkin. I would recommend this laptop to anyone. Great product ASUS, you have gained a new costumer.
customer_reviews.author: Johnb352

customer_reviews.title: Great little chromebook
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little computer for the price. I love the keyboard it's very responsive and comfortable. The screen is very small, but okay for the price. The biggest problem is the edge. Right where my wrists rest, it is sharp. I put stickers over it for now, but will be purchasing wrist rests.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: They put shut down button where the delete button belongs/ local memory very difficult to access
customer_reviews.text: Chrome Book put the shut down button where the delete button normally goes; causing me to have to restart the device every time I instinctively tried to delete something. I ordered one with extra local memory as I don't want to put my stuff on the cloud. The device is designed to hide the local memory location from you to force you to use the cloud. I'm an electrical engineer from the computer and electronics school and it took me forever to save to the local memory any time I attempted to do so. I sent the Chrome Book back to Amazon the day after it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B Dobervich

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these as Christmas gifts for a 6 and 9 year old. They like them and my 9 year old uses his for homework too. Got them off my laptop and computer which is why I bought them their own devices. They seem to be built a bit more rugged. We have been using them for almost a month and they are holding up nicely. I created a family group on google and set them each up with a few apps. They are pretty small but work nicely and they can take them with them anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: azamazonfan

product_meta.title: ASUS Chromebook C202 Laptop- 11.6" Ruggedized and Spill Resistant Design with 180 Degree Hinge, Intel Celeron N3060, 4GB RAM, 16GB eMMC Storage, Chrome OS- C202SA-YS02 Dark Blue, Silver
product_meta.description: Style:16GB Flash Storage| Pattern Name:SingleASUS Dark Blue, Chromebook, C202SA-YS02, 11.6" HD+ (1366768), Matte, Intel Dual-Core Celeron N3060 1.6 GHz, 4GB DDR3L, Intel HD, 16GB EEMC + TPM, Chrome OS, 802.11ac, HD Webcam, Bluetooth 4.2 support WIDI
feature_bullets: Ready for drops and spills with rugged construction with reinforced rubber guards, easy grip handles, and a spill resistant keyboard
Lightweight 2.65 pound body and rugged construction that can be dropped from 3.9 feet so you can take it anywhere without disruption
11.6 inches HD 1366x768 anti-glare display, with 180 degree hinge for easy viewing
Powered by the Intel Celeron N3060 Processor (2M Cache, upto 2.48 GHz) for fast and snappy performance
4 GB DDR3 RAM; 16GB flash storage; No CD or DVD drive; Power adapter: Input: 100 -240 V AC, 50/60 Hz universal. Output : 19 V DC, 2.1 A, 40 W

Chromebook runs on Chrome OS - an operating system by Google that is built for the way we live today. It comes with built-in virus protection, updates automatically, boots up in seconds and continues to stay fast over time
All the Google apps you know and love come standard on every Chromebook, which means you can edit, download, and convert Microsoft Office files in Google Docs, Sheets and Slides
With the Google Play Store, you can access a rich library of apps, games, music, movies, TV, books, magazines, and more, all from your Chromebook
Chromebooks come with built-in storage for offline access to your most important files and an additional 100GB of Google Drive space to ensure that all of your files are backed up automatically

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,045 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
